messages.message: Hihi, resetting up my dev environment and running into the issue where localhost doesn't receive any data. webapp is running - I get a response at localhost:5000 though the css is missing, which makes sense if that's supposed to come from server-nginx. The server-nginx docker is up but doesn't seem to be receiving any requests. I see no logs being printed
What happens if you just navigate to localhost without the 5000?
that's where i get the "didn't send any data" error message
do you know who owns the nginx container now that will is gone?

hey lydia, did you run `make run-docker-proxy` or `make run-docker`?
first one is the correct command for local setup
i started it using python provisioner.py start --as-docker

lemme try restarting my computer. i remember having these heisenbugs with nginx a lot. will thought maybe there was some issue with the docker communication? has anyone else run into connection issues with server-nginx that seem to go away if you restart docker or your laptop?

provisioner script by default uses run-docker-proxy, so it’s fine on that front.
can you check if the url is `http://..` instead of `https://..`.
maybe try this variation too
it is http://

try this: https://localhost/account/login?next=%2F
if this doesn’t work then maybe restart the system :sweat_smile:
nope doesn't work. i think the issue is localhost is not connecting to the server-nginx container
thanks!
did you figure this out?
still doesn't seem to work
maybe i should rebuild the image locally?
ya there might be something wrong with the prebuilt image
i ran into this this morning too, just saw this message - rebuilding nginx locally works for me
`make clean build-docker run-docker-proxy`
it took a long time to build nginx though :slightly_smiling_face:
yup that did it :slightly_smiling_face: took awhile cause i had a bunch of tooling updates to make sigh
